skill.name: citation-management
skill.description: Comprehensive citation management for academic research. Search Google Scholar and PubMed for papers, extract accurate metadata, validate citations, and generate properly formatted BibTeX entries. This skill should be used when you need to find papers, verify citation information, convert DOIs to BibTeX, or ensure reference accuracy in scientific writing.
skill.summary: Comprehensive citation management for academic research. Search Google Scholar and PubMed for papers...
skill.author: K-Dense-AI

security_audit.summary: Legitimate academic citation management tool. Static scanner produced 1124 false positives by misinterpreting markdown code blocks as Ruby backticks, BibTeX citation keys as cryptographic keys, and documentation URLs as network endpoints. Actual Python scripts make legitimate API calls to public academic databases (CrossRef, PubMed, arXiv) and use standard environment variable patterns for optional API credentials.

content.value_statement: Find and validate academic citations from Google Scholar and PubMed. Extract metadata from DOIs, PMIDs, and arXiv IDs. Generate clean, properly formatted BibTeX entries for your research papers.
actual_capabilities: Search Google Scholar and PubMed with advanced filters
Extract metadata from DOI, PMID, arXiv ID, or URL
Validate citations for accuracy and completeness
Verify DOIs and detect broken references
limitations: Google Scholar access may be rate-limited without proper authentication
Does not support citation styles other than BibTeX
Requires internet connection for API queries

use_cases.title: Build literature bibliographies
use_cases.description: Search databases, extract metadata, and compile reference lists for papers and theses.

use_cases.title: Verify citation accuracy
use_cases.description: Validate existing citations and fix errors before manuscript submission.

use_cases.title: Generate BibTeX entries
use_cases.description: Convert paper identifiers to properly formatted citations for LaTeX documents.

prompt_templates.title: Find Papers
prompt_templates.prompt: Search Google Scholar for papers on [TOPIC] published after [YEAR]. Export the top [N] results to BibTeX format.

prompt_templates.title: Extract Metadata
prompt_templates.prompt: Extract metadata from DOI [DOI] and generate a properly formatted BibTeX entry.

prompt_templates.title: Validate Bibliography
prompt_templates.prompt: Validate my BibTeX file at [PATH] and report any errors or missing fields. Suggest fixes.

prompt_templates.title: Clean Citations
prompt_templates.prompt: Format my bibliography file, remove duplicates, sort by author, and ensure consistent citation key naming.

output: Validation: DOI verified, all required fields present

best_practices: Always validate citations before final manuscript submission
Use DOIs when available for most reliable metadata extraction
Run deduplication to avoid duplicate references in your bibliography
anti_patterns: Manually typing BibTeX entries instead of extracting from metadata sources
Skipping validation after automatic citation extraction
Using inconsistent citation key naming conventions across files

faq.question: What databases can I search?
faq.answer: Google Scholar and PubMed. Use Google Scholar for broad coverage and PubMed for biomedical literature.

faq.question: What identifiers does it support?
faq.answer: DOI, PMID, arXiv ID, PMCID, and URLs from major publishers like Nature and Science.

faq.question: Can it validate existing citations?
faq.answer: Yes. Use validate_citations.py to check DOIs, required fields, syntax, and duplicates.

faq.question: Does it need API keys?
faq.answer: Optional for PubMed. Set NCBI_API_KEY and NCBI_EMAIL environment variables for higher rate limits.

faq.question: What output formats?
faq.answer: JSON and BibTeX. Most scripts support both formats via --format flag.

faq.question: Can it deduplicate citations?
faq.answer: Yes. Use format_bibtex.py with --deduplicate flag to find and remove duplicate entries.
